title: Fix histogram visibility
body:
This PR fixes the `setSideHistogramDisplayed(False)` when the widget or one of the ancestor is not visible.

`isVisible()` is one of the property which is not symmetric to `setVisible()`.

As result `isSideHistogramDisplayed` was false is some cases for false reason.
Which was inhibiting `setSideHistogramDisplayed`.

Changelog: 
- Fix ImageView histogram visibility

title: Dedicated function to parse gl version
body:
I found that the GL version was not properly parsed.

It was returning `51, 48` for a string version `3.0`.
Because the string was bytes and indexes was returning ordinal of char `3` and `0`

This parsing issue was probably broken in python 3 since the beginning. Or it is a change in the behavior of PyOpenGL.

This PR create a dedicated function to return this version.

Changelog: 
- Fix GL version parsing

title: silx.gui.plot.PlotWidget: Fixed OpenGL image rendering of arcsinh colormap for uint8 and uint16
body:
This PR fixes an issue in the OpenGL backend when displaying colormapped image of `uint8` and `uint16` with the `arcsinh` scale.

With `uint8` and `uint16`, the texture is seen from the shader as normalized values in [0, 1].
Previous implementation was normalizing the bounds of the colormap range in this case before providing it to the shader. While this is fine for linear, log, sqrt an gamma scale (which are special cases), it fails for arcsinh (and in the general case).
Instead of relying on special cases, this PR changes the implementation by reverting the normalization in the shader to perform the normalization with the data rather than the normalized one.

title: [plot] ValueError: year 0 is out of range
body:
Hi all,

We encountered an error for a `PlotWidget` with a datetime x-axis. The issue occurs when you zoom out too much. Sometimes this can happen when the mouse wheel is rotated too quickly.

A `ValueError` occurs when a year outside the range [1, 9999] is passed to this `datetime.datetime()` constructor: https://github.com/silx-kit/silx/blob/master/src/silx/gui/plot/_utils/dtime_ticklayout.py#L163.

This happens when on line 363 `niceSpacing` exceeds `dVal`. For example: if the lower limit of the x-axis is 1500 years, `niceSpacing` can be 1000 but it cannot become 2000 years. If the lower limit is 400 years, `niceSpacing` can be 200 but it cannot become 500 years. Such a condition occurs more rapidly if the plot widget is small (small `nTicks`).

Perhaps a similar solution could be used as for issue #3192.

I have included the traceback. I am using silx version 0.9.0 on Debian 10. For the time being, I have solved our issue by setting limits and range constraints for the x-axis.

[traceback.txt](https://github.com/silx-kit/silx/files/7661184/traceback.txt)

title: Issue with setLimits and keepAspectRation
body:
In some cases I would like to define the plot area / limits before calling "Plot.addImage" (without resetting the zoom).

This work until we don't want to keep the aspect ration. When we ask to keep it then a part of the image is not displayed.

I tried to play with some `resetZoom`, `_setDirty`, use directly `Axis`...
The `PlotWidget.setLimits` function seems fine and the limits of the plot are not the same for the two backends.
But it looks like both are failing. Do you have any idea about the origin of it ?

Here is the simplest piece of code to reproduce it:
``` python
from silx.gui import qt
from silx.gui.plot import Plot2D
import numpy

app = qt.QApplication([])

# add plot widget 1
plot_widget_1 = Plot2D(backend="opengl")
plot_widget_1.setKeepDataAspectRatio(True)
plot_widget_1.setLimits(0, 216, 0, 216)
data = numpy.random.random(216*216).reshape(216, 216)
plot_widget_1.addImage(data, resetzoom=False)

plot_widget_1.show()
app.exec_()
```

title: Memory leak on opengl backend plots
body:
There is a lazy remove on the OpenGL backend in order to clean up OpenGL item in the right thread.

This code is executed during the `paintGL`.

If the plot is never displayed, items are never cleaned up.

But the plot can be updated with new items which will be never displayed.

As result the amount of items increase, until the plot is displayed again.

When using tabs, it's really common to have hidden plots.

----

With Flint, while the plot was on an hidden tab.

The plot is a curve plot with only 3 curves.

```
In [7]: len(w._silxPlot()._backend._glGarbageCollector)
Out[7]: 2190
```

After a display of this tab

```
In [8]: len(w._silxPlot()._backend._glGarbageCollector)
Out[8]: 0
```

----

A backport to 0.14 would be very welcome.

title: silx view NXdata image stack reset zooms when scrolling images
body:
For a 3D array, depending on the way NXdata is specified, either a `_NXdataImageView` (when only `signal` is given) or a `_NXdataStackView` (when both `signal` and `axes` are given) is used to view.

The difference is that with `_NXdataImageView`, the zoom is reset when scrolling the stack which is cumbersome.
It is fine with `_NXdataStackView`.

Here is a simple fix (I didn't checked for side effects):
```
silx/gui/data/NXdataWidgets.py
@@ -511,7 +511,7 @@ class ArrayImagePlot(qt.QWidget):
             self._plot.getYAxis().setScale('linear')
             self._plot.addImage(image, legend=legend,
                                 origin=origin, scale=scale,
-                                replace=True)
+                                replace=True, resetzoom=False)
         else:
             xaxisscale, yaxisscale = self._axis_scales
```
but maybe there is a need to change the handling of priorities of views to use a  `_NXdataImageView` in this case.

title: ERROR: a bytes-like object is required, not 'str' (h5py v3.0.0)
body:
In the latest months I successfully used `silx` for many data analysis projects and it worked like a charm.

I'm using it in the standard Python + Virtual Environment scenario, but yesterday I had to reinstall it from scratch and when I opened a previously working HDF5 file I received the following error:
```
a bytes-like object is required, not 'str'   File "/home/bartoli/.virtualenvs/ml/lib/python3.8/site-packages/silx/gui/hdf5/Hdf5TreeModel.py", line 520, in data
    return node.dataDescription(role)
  File "/home/bartoli/.virtualenvs/ml/lib/python3.8/site-packages/silx/gui/hdf5/Hdf5Item.py", line 564, in dataDescription
    kind, _label = self.__getDataDescription()
  File "/home/bartoli/.virtualenvs/ml/lib/python3.8/site-packages/silx/gui/hdf5/Hdf5Item.py", line 558, in __getDataDescription
    self.__description = self.__computeDataDescription()
  File "/home/bartoli/.virtualenvs/ml/lib/python3.8/site-packages/silx/gui/hdf5/Hdf5Item.py", line 527, in __computeDataDescription
    return DescriptionType.VALUE, self._getFormatter().humanReadableValue(self.obj)
  File "/home/bartoli/.virtualenvs/ml/lib/python3.8/site-packages/silx/gui/hdf5/Hdf5Formatter.py", line 110, in humanReadableValue
    text = self.__formatter.toString(numpy_object, dtype=dataset.dtype)
  File "/home/bartoli/.virtualenvs/ml/lib/python3.8/site-packages/silx/gui/data/TextFormatter.py", line 299, in toString
    text = [self.toString(d, dtype) for d in data]
  File "/home/bartoli/.virtualenvs/ml/lib/python3.8/site-packages/silx/gui/data/TextFormatter.py", line 299, in <listcomp>
    text = [self.toString(d, dtype) for d in data]
  File "/home/bartoli/.virtualenvs/ml/lib/python3.8/site-packages/silx/gui/data/TextFormatter.py", line 302, in toString
    text = self.__formatH5pyObject(data, dtype)
  File "/home/bartoli/.virtualenvs/ml/lib/python3.8/site-packages/silx/gui/data/TextFormatter.py", line 270, in __formatH5pyObject
    return self.__formatText(data)
  File "/home/bartoli/.virtualenvs/ml/lib/python3.8/site-packages/silx/gui/data/TextFormatter.py", line 200, in __formatText
    text = "\"%s\"" % text.replace("\\", "\\\\").replace("\"", "\\\"")
```
After a bit of investigation, I found that `requirements.txt` of `silx` install the latest version of `h5py` that 3 days ago was bumped to **v3.0.0** and that is the cause of this error. Forcing the installation of the previous **v2.10.0** of `h5py` solves that.

While waiting for an update of `silx` compatibility against the latest version of `h5py`, this problem can be solved by adding the line `h5py==2.10.0` in `requirements.txt`.

Can anybody else reproduce this?

Thanks

title: plot3d PositionInfoWidget issue with high-dpi screen
body:
With high-dpi screen, there is an issue with plot3d `PositionInfoWidget`.

The mouse position is converted with `QWidget.mapFromGlobal` (see [doc](https://doc.qt.io/archives/qt-5.13/qwidget.html#mapFromGlobal):

https://github.com/silx-kit/silx/blob/fe8256f30918a4aaa479d1fa8d34f361822556e4/silx/gui/plot3d/tools/PositionInfoWidget.py#L216

Where I would expect to get the position in widget "logical" pixel but actual screen pixel is returned.

Tested on macos10.12 with python3.7 and pyqt5.13.2

That's easy to fix, but it would need more testing: I wonder whether it is an issue with Qt/macos or a general behavior...

But maybe this `FocusManager` behavior was normal and there is better way to fix the middle pan in `DrawSelectMode`.

title: [math] FFT test fails with FFTW
body:
FFT with backend fftw fails with C2C transform. 
AFAIK nothing was changed since version 0.12. The only thing I see is numpy having changed its internal FFT backend ([pocketFFT](https://numpy.org/devdocs/release/1.17.0-notes.html)) since `1.17.0`, but then tests should fail with other backends (not only fftw).

Anyway the metric is Maximum Absolute Difference (`max_i |x_i - y_i|`). 
It is not surprising to see `MAD = 0.3` on float32 precision, I wonder why we did not have this issue before.

```bash
======================================================================
FAIL: test_fftw (silx.math.fft.test.test_fft.TestFFT) (trdim='2D', mode='C2C', size=(512, 512))
----------------------------------------------------------------------

title: setStepType only available in Qt 5.12
body:
Hi,

I got this exception with `silx view`, packaged for debian10 (Qt5 version 5.11.3):
```
  File "/usr/lib/python3/dist-packages/silx/gui/dialog/ColormapDialog.py", line 869, in __init__
    self._gammaSpinBox.setStepType(qt.QDoubleSpinBox.AdaptiveDecimalStepType)
```

This function was introduced in Qt 5.12.

This is a regression introduced recently by:
https://github.com/silx-kit/silx/pull/3054

title: Issue with 3D scene items inheritance
body:
I have the following issue with current master with `example/plot3dSceneWindow.py`:
```
File "examples/plot3dSceneWindow.py", line 136, in <module>
    clipPlane = items.ClipPlane()  # Create a new clipping plane item
  File "silx/gui/plot3d/items/clipplane.py", line 52, in __init__
    Item3D.__init__(self, parent=parent, primitive=plane)
  File "silx/gui/plot3d/items/core.py", line 92, in __init__
    qt.QObject.__init__(self, parent)
TypeError: __init__() missing 1 required positional argument: 'plane'
```
The issue is with `PyQt5` (tested with 5.12.1 and 5.14.2) but with `PySide2` it works fine.

This looks to be due to https://github.com/silx-kit/silx/commit/d9a11d543c5885346562e161ed46a19c19ff23bf
`ClipPlane` is the only item with this issue, so it seems to be related to the fact that the mix-in takes an argument (as `PlaneMixIn` does).

title: [plot] StackView issue with colormap
body:
There seems to be an issue with `StackView` colormap handling.

To reproduce:

```
import numpy
from silx import sx                                                     
w = sx.StackView()                                                      
w.show()                                                                
w.setColormap(colormap='viridis', autoscale=True)                       
w.setStack(numpy.arange(10**3).reshape(10, 10, 10))
```

and the colormap used is switching to the grey one....

Setting the colormap with: `w.setColormap(Colormap('viridis'))` or `w.setColormap(colormap='viridis')` works fine.

This looks to be due to setting `self.__autoscaleCmap` (https://github.com/silx-kit/silx/blob/master/silx/gui/plot/StackView.py#L834), which looks like not needed any longer and causing trouble.

Thanks to Alessandro for spotting it.

title: [view] Load all the dataset to display one fame
body:
When displaying a large, compressed data (10001x512x512), *silx view* loads  (and decompresses) the whole dataset  for displaying the first, then the second image which takes a minute each time. The direct retrieval of the first frame of the data with h5py in ipython takes 10ms.

I guess the bug is in silx. Here is the piece of code responsible for writing the dataset:

```    
with h5py.File(outf, 'w') as h5f:
        grp = h5f.create_group('xpcs')
[...]
        dset = grp.create_dataset('imgs', (Nsteps, N, N), np.uint32,
                                  chunks= (1, N, N),
                                  compression="gzip",
                                  shuffle=True)
        # turn the crank
        t0 = time.time()
        for i, fname in enumerate(binfiles):
            pts = read_lammps_bin(fname)
            img = mdscatter.dft(pts, q_points)
            img = np.abs(img)**2
            tot = img.sum()
            print(fname, img.max(), tot)
            dset[i,:,:] = np.round(1e6*np.reshape(img, (N, N))/tot).astype("uint32")
        t1 = time.time() - t0
        print('time taken = %f\n' % t1)
 ```

title: Backprojector: error when padding size is odd
body:
Since v0.10, Backprojector uses Real-to-complex (R2C) FFT for Filtering, and a padding strategy different from v0.9: 

  - In <= 0.9, the padded sinogram size was computed as `size_padded = next_power_of_two(size)`.  
  - From 0.10, it is computed as `size_padded = next_friendly_power(size)`, where `next_friendly_power(n)` gives the closest number in the form `(2**a) * (3**b) * (5**c) * (7**d)`. This avoids excessive memory consumption. 

However in some rare cases, the padded size obtained with the second scheme gives an odd number. Odd numbers are not recommended when using R2C transforms.

Therefore, the padding scheme should not allow odd numbers.

title: Memory leak with scrolling plots in Linux
body:
We use the Silx plot widget for monitoring data that accumulates over a longer period (days) and encounter a memory leak. I've narrowed it down to the following test program.

```
#!/usr/bin/env python3

import gc, os
import numpy as np
from PyQt5 import QtWidgets, QtCore
from silx.gui.plot.PlotWidget import PlotWidget

def parseStatusFile(fileName):
    """ Parses the /proc/<pid>/status file, returns dictionary with values for lines that end in kB
        There may be simpler ways to calculated the memory use but this works (only under Linux)
    """
    result = {}
    with open(fileName) as statFile:
        for line in statFile:
            #print(line)
            key, valStr = line.split(':', 1)
            if valStr.endswith('kB\n'):
                valStr = valStr[:-3] # strip kB
                try:
                    value = int(valStr)
                except Exception:
                    raise
                else:
                    result[key] = int(value)
    return result


class MyWin(QtWidgets.QWidget):
    def __init__(self, parent=None):
        super(MyWin, self).__init__(parent=parent)

        self._prevMemStats = {}
        self._numSamples = 10
        self._x = np.arange(self._numSamples)

        self.contentsLayout = QtWidgets.QVBoxLayout()
        self.setLayout(self.contentsLayout)

        self.plot = PlotWidget(backend='gl')
        self.contentsLayout.addWidget(self.plot)

        self.timer = QtCore.QTimer()
        self.timer.timeout.connect(self.addData)
        self.timer.start(250)

    def addData(self):
        self._x = self._x + self._numSamples # Disabling this line fixes the leak
        self._y = np.random.normal(size=self._numSamples)
        self.plot.addCurve(x=self._x, y=self._y, legend='my-curve', resetzoom=True)
        self.printMemStats()


    def printMemStats(self):
        """ Print memory statistics. Works only under Linux
        """
        memStats = parseStatusFile("/proc/{}/status".format(os.getpid()))
        if self._prevMemStats:
            resSize = memStats['RssAnon']
            resDiff = resSize - self._prevMemStats['RssAnon']
            vmSize = memStats['VmSize']
            vmDiff = vmSize - self._prevMemStats['VmSize']
            print("VmSize: {:9d} kB (diff = {:6d} kB), RssSize: {:9d} kB (diff = {:6d} kB)"
                  .format(vmSize, vmDiff, resSize, resDiff))
        self._prevMemStats = memStats


def main():
    app = QtWidgets.QApplication([])
    win = MyWin()
    win.show()
    app.exec_()

if __name__ == "__main__":
    main()

```

When I let this run and look at the Linux System Monitor (`ksysguard`) I see the _Memory_ colunm increase by almost 1MB per second. The same is visible in the _RES_ column of `top` (which I think is equal to the sum of the _Memory_ and  _Shared Memory_ columns of  `ksysguard`.) 

![screenshot from 2018-09-25 18-06-46](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3320415/46027728-d69a8380-c0ee-11e8-9772-bdfcfb452a9a.png)

For debugging purposes I've managed to print the values of the _Virtual Size_ and _Memory_ columns by means of the `/proc` virtual file system. If I print this every time I plot new data, it looks af follows:

```
VmSize:   1330200 kB (diff =      0 kB), RssSize:     91220 kB (diff =    172 kB)
VmSize:   1328948 kB (diff =  -1252 kB), RssSize:     91228 kB (diff =      8 kB)
VmSize:   1328948 kB (diff =      0 kB), RssSize:     91228 kB (diff =      0 kB)
VmSize:   1329080 kB (diff =    132 kB), RssSize:     91228 kB (diff =      0 kB)
VmSize:   1329080 kB (diff =      0 kB), RssSize:     91480 kB (diff =    252 kB)
VmSize:   1329212 kB (diff =    132 kB), RssSize:     91480 kB (diff =      0 kB)
VmSize:   1329344 kB (diff =    132 kB), RssSize:     91480 kB (diff =      0 kB)

VmSize:   1329672 kB (diff =    132 kB), RssSize:     92000 kB (diff =    256 kB)
VmSize:   1329608 kB (diff =    -64 kB), RssSize:     92044 kB (diff =     44 kB)
VmSize:   1329740 kB (diff =    132 kB), RssSize:     92044 kB (diff =      0 kB)
VmSize:   1329872 kB (diff =    132 kB), RssSize:     92044 kB (diff =      0 kB)
VmSize:   1329876 kB (diff =      4 kB), RssSize:     92296 kB (diff =    252 kB)
VmSize:   1330008 kB (diff =    132 kB), RssSize:     92296 kB (diff =      0 kB)
VmSize:   1330008 kB (diff =      0 kB), RssSize:     92296 kB (diff =      0 kB)
VmSize:   1330136 kB (diff =    128 kB), RssSize:     92536 kB (diff =    240 kB)
VmSize:   1330136 kB (diff =      0 kB), RssSize:     92536 kB (diff =      0 kB)

VmSize:   1330664 kB (diff =      0 kB), RssSize:     93056 kB (diff =      0 kB)
```

As you can see the RssSize value increases with approximately 250 Kb every three or four plots.

It only occurs with the Open-GL backend. if I change the backend to Matplotlib, the increase will go to zero after a while.

It seems to be related to scrolling. If I use the same X-coordinates in every plot, or use `resetzoom=False` the problem goes away.

I don't know If the issue occurs on Windows or OS-X. I hope you guys can test it under Linux.

title: [gui] Lost active curve on plot interaction

It should be possible to toggle off that behavior without having to inherit PlotWidget.

It is very cumbersome in applications associating actions to single mouse clicks in the plot area.

title: [io] SegFault when opening spec file without scans
body:
`silx.io.specfile.SpecFile` segfault if there is no scan in the file.

As it is now, it looks for `#S` or `#F` in the first 10 lines of the file...
Looking for `#S` in the entire file (as pymca does) - and may be also look for `#F` (spec's spec to be checked) - turns the segfault into a python exception.

* [ ] The histogram only applies when it is called for the first time. It gets updated when changing the image to another image, but not when changing to an NXdata image display.

title: [plot] Resetzoom not always working on right Y axis
body:
There is an issue with reset zoom for curves on Y right axis which seems to appear when curves are moved from left to right axis

Code to reproduce:
```
from silx import sx
w = sx.plot()
w.addCurve((1, 2), (1, 10), legend='b')
w.addCurve((1, 2), (1, 2), legend='a')
for curve in w.getAllCurves():
    curve.setYAxis('right')
w.resetZoom()
```

title: silx view aborts when opening IPython console
body:
With silx 0.7.0 on debian8 (rnice8 at least) silx view aborts when one tries to open the embedded IPython console from the GUI.

To reproduce: visualize some curves with silx view and open IPython console (Options->Console).

Error message:
```
QWidget: Must construct a QApplication before a QPaintDevice
Aborted
```

On another debian8 computer silx view breaks while loading IPython widget tries to load PyQt4 while silx view loads PyQt5.

title: ValueError on opening spec.dat file
body:
I get a strangely irregular error when opening the same .dat specfile in a loop similar to this:

from silx.io.spech5 import SpecH5
for i in range(10):
  sfh5 = SpecH5(spec_fname)   
  scan_list   = sfh5.keys()
  scan_group = '{}.1'.format(i)    
  if scan_group not in scan_list:
    print(scan_list)
    raise ValueError('Scan number {} not found in scan list printed above'.format(scan_group))
  more calculations using sfh5[scan_group]
  sfh5.close()

Every 5-10 attempts to open the specfile fail with this traceback:

Traceback:
    sfh5 = SpecH5(spec_fname)   
  File "/mntdirect/_data_id13_inhouse6/COMMON_DEVELOP/py_andreas/aj_venv/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/silx/io/spech5.py", line 573, in __init__
    scan_group = ScanGroup(scan_key, parent=self, scan=scan)
  File "/mntdirect/_data_id13_inhouse6/COMMON_DEVELOP/py_andreas/aj_venv/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/silx/io/spech5.py", line 627, in __init__
    self.add_node(MeasurementGroup(parent=self, scan=scan))
  File "/mntdirect/_data_id13_inhouse6/COMMON_DEVELOP/py_andreas/aj_venv/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/silx/io/spech5.py", line 814, in __init__
    data=scan.data_column_by_name(label),
  File "silx/io/specfile.pyx", line 594, in silx.io.specfile.Scan.data_column_by_name
  File "silx/io/specfile.pyx", line 947, in silx.io.specfile.SpecFile.data_column_by_name
ValueError: negative dimensions are not allowed


I don't want to move the opening of the specfile outside the loop as there are many more calculations steps per loop that don't need it. I can catch the error like this, but I wanted to report the issue nevertheless:
    specfile_open = False
    while not specfile_open:
        try:
            sfh5 = SpecH5(spec_fname)
            specfile_open = True
        except ValueError as msg:
            print(msg)
            print('Got ValueError opening specfile, retrying')

silx.version = '0.7.0'

With matplotlib backend, curves on right axis cannot be selected with the mouse.

To reproduce:

from silx import sx

```
and click on the red curve

title: [convert] file series fail because of None in attrs
body:
When merging a file series with *silx convert*, the process now fails because the "file" attribute *@filename* is *None*. 
This causes the following error:
`TypeError: Object dtype dtype('O') has no native HDF5 equivalent`

I think that previously it didn't crash because the was a coercion of all attributes to a dtype *numpy.string_*, so we ended up with a *@filename=b"None"*. 

I'm not sure if this is a `fabioh5` bug or a `silx.io.convert` bug.

In `silx.io.convert`, this patch fixes the issue:

```
diff --git a/silx/io/convert.py b/silx/io/convert.py
index 3af2c44..a2839fd 100644
--- a/silx/io/convert.py
+++ b/silx/io/convert.py
@@ -165,8 +165,9 @@ class Hdf5Writer(object):
         root_grp = h5f[self.h5path]
         for key in infile.attrs:
             if self.overwrite_data or key not in root_grp.attrs:
-                root_grp.attrs.create(key,
-                                      infile.attrs[key])
+                if infile.attrs[key] is not None:
+                    root_grp.attrs.create(key,
+                                          infile.attrs[key])
```
 
If we want to fix this In `fabioh5`, we could set the `@filename` attribute to "", or "None", or drop it altogether.

title: [silx view] hdf5plugin not installed message
body:
Both, silx.io and fabio import h5py. Therefore when the application tries to import hdf5plugin, the later cannot be imported because h5py is already imported.

That is desired behavior when somebody is using the library, but not for the silx view application.

The try/except with the warning (or without) around the import of hdf5plugin should be moved before any of silx.io or fabio are imported.

title: [gui] Calling 2 times NumpyAxesSelector.setAxisNames is not working
body: A work around is to call `clear` before calling `setAxeNames`, and finally setting again the data.

title: [plot] Colormap
body:
This PR uses `Colormap.getColormapRange` method to initialize matplotlib colormap used in the backend.
This avoids copies of code doing the same stuff, and the code preparing matplolib colormap was doing it poorly regarding autoscale of only one boundary (which is now available from the colormap dialog).

from silx.gui import qt
from silx.gui.plot import PlotWidget

plot.addCurve(x=[0, 2], y=[10, 20])

plot.show()
app.exec_()
```

title: [plot3d] ScalarFieldView cut plane might drift
body:
When the cut plane is set to use nearest interpolation, it might slowly drift over time (actually repaints).
This is due to bug in an offset that is added to avoid visual glitches when the cut plane is exactly at the edge between 2 slices of the 3D volume.
Instead of being added once, this offset is accumulated at each repaint.

To reproduce: With examples/viewer3DVolume.py set the cut plane to be visible and use nearest interpolation and then rotate the scene for a while (in order to perform many repaints).

body: Seems that silx dependencies (h5py...) are not taking into account when installing the wheel under macOS.

title: [plot] Updating a curve with color defined for each point fails
body:
To reproduce:
```
from silx import sx
w = sx.Plot1D()
w.show()
w.addCurve((1, 2), (1, 2), color=((1., 0., 0.), (0., 0., 1.)), symbol='o', linestyle='')
w.addCurve((1, 2), (1, 2), color=((1., 0., 0.), (0., 0., 1.)), symbol='o', linestyle='')
```

2nd `addCurve` fails with error:
```
silx/gui/plot/items/core.pyc in setColor(self, color, copy)
    567                 assert color.ndim == 2
    568 
--> 569         if self._color != color:
    570             self._color = color
    571             self._updated(ItemChangedType.COLOR)

ValueError: The truth value of an array with more than one element is ambiguous. Use a.any() or a.all()
```

Replacing `if self._color != color:` with `if not numpy.all(numpy.equal(self._color, color)):` solves the issue.

title: ColorBarWidget issues
body:
PR #878 hightlighted a few issues in the `ColorBarWidget`

Issues:
- `ColorBarWidget` is not synchronized when `PlotWidget`'s default colormap is updated.
- Changing the colormap from `ColormapDialog` does not update the colorbar.
- From the console, doing an `addImage` with a different colormap does not update the colorbar immediately. It is only updated when `PlotWindow` gets the focus when clicking on it.
- ColorBar.py l809 `assert(type(self._vmin) == type(self._vmax))`: why is it needed? One can enter vmin=1, vmax=1.5 and it should work.
- If setting a colorbar with vmin == vmax, the colorbar gradient is not updated and displays the previous colormap.
- Using ImageData.setColormap on the active image does not update the colorbar.

Those issues were found using PR #878 branch.

Improvements:
- large values of vmin or vmax enlarges the width of the colorbar. The QLabels could span over/under the ticks to minimize the width of the colorbar + we could display those values with a limited number of significant digits (and have the full value displayed in a tooltip). Anyway, I would not enlarge the colorbar gradient above a certain width.
- It is probably worth listening for active image changes only when the ColorBarWidget is visible.

Refactoring:
- Refactor set|getColormap to only store it once in _ColorScale (and do the checks once) and have proxy to access it in other classes.
- Use a common implementation of checks and erroneous cases (e.g., negative bound with log scale) for the plot and the colorbar.
- In _ColorScale, it looks possible to create the QLinearGradient during setColormap rather than for each paintEvent.

Fixing some of those issues would probably be easier with item's signals (#689) and colormap object ( #146).

title: [fitmanager] fitmanager assumes that fitfunction can be decomposed into sum of base functions
body:
A `FitTheory` defines a number of parameter names. When the estimation function returns a number of estimated parameters that is larger than the number of defined parameter names, `FitManager` assumes that that the function to be fitted is a sum of N times the fit function (N being the number of estimated parameters divided by the number of base parameters for this theory).

This worked for all theories defined up to now, because the functions in `silx.math.fit.functions` that accept a variable number of parameters are defined as a sum of a base functions:

 `sum_gauss(x, h0, c0, fwhm0,  h1, c1, fwhm1) = sum_gauss(x, h0, c0, fwhm0) + sum_gauss(x, h1, c1, fwhm1)`

A good example for which this assumption breaks is a fit theory that defines a polynomial whose order is defined by the number of parameters.
- `poly(x, a, b, c) = a*x**2 + b*x + c` ->order=2 
- `poly(x, a, b, c, d) = a*x**3 + b*x**2 + c*x + d` -> order=3 

`poly(x, a, b, c) ≠  poly(x, a) +  poly(x, b) + poly(x, c)`

title: [DatasetView] transpose method does not work as expected on already transposed DatasetView instance
body:
In the current implementation, `DatasetView.transpose(t)` does not take into account whether or not the data was already transposed. Instead of transposing the already transposed view, it transposes the underlying original data with a new transposition tuple `t`.

This examples illustrates the difference in behavior between a regular numpy array and a DatasetView.
```
>>> from silx.utils.array_like import DatasetView
>>> import numpy
>>> 
>>> a = numpy.arange(4).reshape((2, 2))
>>> a
array([[0, 1],
       [2, 3]])
>>> a.T
array([[0, 2],
       [1, 3]])
>>> a.T.T
array([[0, 1],
       [2, 3]])
>>> numpy.array_equal(a.T.T, a)
True
>>> 
>>> 
>>> b = DatasetView(a)
>>> numpy.array_equal(b, a)
True
>>> numpy.array(b.transpose((1, 0)))
array([[0, 2],
       [1, 3]])
>>> numpy.array(b.transpose((1, 0)).transpose((1, 0)))   # bad result
array([[0, 2],
       [1, 3]])
>>> numpy.array_equal(b.transpose((1, 0)).transpose((1, 0)), 
                      a.transpose((1, 0)).transpose((1, 0)))    # bad result
False
```

Do we want cythonization to work on Debian 7 or bump required Cython version to 0.21?

title: [plot] KeepAspectRatio=True => Images/Plots not centered
body:
Images and plot are not centered when keep aspect ration is set.

``` python
import numpy as np
from silx.gui import qt as Qt
from silx.gui import plot

data = np.ones((100, 200))
data[0::5, 0::5] = 0

app = Qt.QApplication([])
plotWin = plot.PlotWindow()

# plotWin.setActiveCurveHandling(False)
plotWin.setKeepDataAspectRatio(True)

app.exec_()
```

title: [Hdf5Item] Unecessary (?) data copy.
body:
I've been playing a bit with the model, it works great except when opening large datasets (possibly compressed datasets).

I think this is the culprit (in Hdf5Item::dataValue):

``` python
numpy_object = self.obj.value
```

DataSet.value returns a copy of the dataset (i.e : reads the whole dataset from the file). And since dataValue (with role=DisplayRole) can be called several times (at least twice, for each dataset displayed) when expanding an item, when the view is resized, or even when the view is destroyed (!)... each dataset gets decompressed several times.

Data should be loaded only if necessary : DataSet.shape should be used instead (doesn't load the dataset).

Also it looks like DataSet.value has been deprecated since h5py 2.1

title: [Hdf5Widget] Hdf5TreeModel::index : "parent" as a keyword.
body: The index method signature in Hdf5TreeModel is not the same as in its base class (QAbstractItemModel) : in the latter "parent" is a keyword, and the index returned is relative to the root item when omitted.

title: [Plot] Right axis range not updated.
body:
The behaviour of the right Y axis (and all plots associated with it) is wrong.

``` python
import numpy as np
from silx.gui import qt

from silx.gui.plot import PlotWindow

app = qt.QApplication([])

plotWin = PlotWindow()

plotWin.addCurve(np.arange(100), np.arange(100), legend='p1', yaxis='left')
plotWin.addCurve(2*np.arange(100), np.arange(100), legend='p2', yaxis='right')

plotWin.setKeepDataAspectRatio(True)
plotWin.show()
app.exec_()
```

title: [plot] Polygon : last click position added to the vertices list
body:
When drawing a polygon :
- if the user left clicks on the first point (in order to close the path), that position is added to the list of vertices, and then the first vertex position is added. Only the first position of the first vertex should be appended.
- if the user right clicks on the plot, the mouse position should be compared to the position of the first vertex, and only added to the list if it's not equal (or within range) of that first vertex.

Also : sometimes the mouse has time to move between the mouse press event starting the Select state and the corresponding mouse release, witch means that sometimes we have two very close vertices. This is a very minor bug (like the two others). The distance between the first point and the corresponding mouse release should be checked.

This "bug" has gone unnoticed because its impact is minimal, it just adds a vertex that is very close to the first one.

title: spectoh5: attributes not created when creating groups or datasets
body:
This is a bug in my code. 

When reading a SpecFile and interpreting it as a HDF5 with `silx.io.spech5`, HDF5-like attributes are attached to some groups and datasets as a dictionary. For instance, the root group has the following `.attrs`: `{"NX_class": "NXroot"}`.

These attributes are currently not being written to the output HDF5 file when converting a SpecFile using functions from  `silx.io.spectoh5`.

title: ConfigDict can't handle empty strings, strings containing "%" and None
body:
Reading back empty strings causes a crash on all version of python (easy to fix).

Having a "%" character inside a string works with python2 but not python3 (we probably need to escape `%` at some stage).

Reading back `None` yields the string `"None"` (probably easy to fix).

#29

Printing the RNG state in case of failure.
Forced some sums to float64.

title: [histogramnd] unit tests vs histogramdd failure (rare)
body:
A couple tests from one test suite (the one where histogramnd is compared to histogramdd) can sometimes fail due to some precision error (when using np.all_close when comparing both results).
This suite was only added in order to test histogramnd with large data sets (everything is pretty much already covered by the other tests, i think, but with very small hand written data sets).

The failure rate is low (as far as I know), but still...

Possible solutions :
- at the very least print the state of the random number generator (RNG) when there is a fail so we can reproduce the result (@kif's  suggestion)
- remove those tests from the automatically executed tests (run them manualy when needed)
- generate a data set that works, manualy validate the results, and then provide that data with the tests (or actually just the RNG state)

title: Multiple builds of specfile ...
body:
When calling multiple times::

  python setup.py build

Each time the cython file is re-generatd and re-compiled which makes the build time huge. Other project don't have this behaviour, it is probably a bug in the local setup.py

title: Setup uses cython even if WITH_CYTHON is False
body:
Currently, if setup.py is called with the environment variable WITH_CYTHON set to
- True : setup doesn't use cython, the pre-generated C files are used.
- False : setup uses cython

Judging by the code (the other lines all set WITH_CYTHON to False when not using cython) this should probably be the opposite.
